revised_title: High-Temperature Design Procedures for Advanced Materials
tldr: This article discusses the development of design procedures for high-temperature materials, focusing on the integration of materials science and the role of material mechanisms in component performance. The author explains the mechanics and mechanisms of high-temperature design, including the use of reference stress, deformation bounds, and continuum damage mechanics. The article also highlights the importance of understanding the underlying mechanisms to create efficient test programs and extrapolation techniques for high-temperature materials.
